lexUnit.name: recognize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: identify as already known; know again.

sentence.text: When he spoke again , Bernice recognized the staccato growl that meant business .
And the reason why she had been so slow to recognise him was that on the ship he had looked so much older .
He was walking into Queen Charlotte 's Alley before he recognized where he was .
His aunt recognised him immediately as the well-known local ` drug squad " detective .
He had recognised the driver as the hangman from Tyburn .
You might recognize her by her kind and open face , a simplicity which you could easily overlook .
They recognized it by his ring .
Evidently they recognized the entrance by its surrounding landmarks , not by any stimulus from the entrance itself .
He recognized them by the bright overalls they wore .
You 'll recognise good retailers by their thoroughness .
One immediately recognizes the building from Constable 's many paintings of it .
Ilse Huber recognized him at once from his file photo as she stood at the barrier beside the security police .
Maxham was the first to appear ; Celia recognized him from his previous visits to the office .
She had n't recognised him from the back , and now she stared at him in surprise .
But quick-thinking wife Philippa recognised the symptoms from the show and called an ambulance .
` I thought I recognized you from the television . "
Robinson recognizes a friend from Uxbridge Police Station .
` We recognise you from your portrait , " said Melissa .
Some humans can recognise consciousness in plants and effectively communicate with them .
She had time to recognize the face on Third Avenue , then the man was upon her .
To start with you must teach the computer to recognise your writing by giving it examples of the way you write individual letters .
But , as she recognised him from yesterday , so she knew that he had recognised her too .
It was better , he decided , that she did n't recognise him for now , disguised as he was .
People passing through recognize it from afar , by the clouds of coal dust darkening the air .
No wonder none of his friends had recognized him : he had changed colour .
I barely recognised him .
How do you recognize Jasmine ?
Some girls I knew had arranged for their two penfriends to meet me at the Gare du Nord and , somehow , we recognised one another .
Do you recognise yourself ?
` I should recognize him when I see him -- we were playmates . "
You would n't recognise me if you met me in the bath . "
Standing with folded arms by the vault door was another of the partners Romanov recognised from the previous day .
I 'd like to be sure there 's no one there whom you recognise from the past .
Callahan picked on one he recognized from photos .
A lot of them I recognized from school : they were in the pub every night , with their dads , and would be there for ever , never going away .
Leopold Mozart was totally devoted to his brilliant son , whose extraordinary talents he recognized from the start .
The Bishop said grace in a Latin form which Julia thought she recognised from Trinity High Table .
Instantly , she recognised from his voice that there was something seriously wrong with her brother .
These symptoms may be difficult to recognize in a patient after anaesthesia .
He had smugly recognized in Patricia symptoms of what he was pleased to term an adolescent crush on himself .
One type of albino child is very easy to recognise because of his very fair hair , paler skin and the pinkish appearance of the eyes .
These fossils constitute the second group recognized here , the Kenyapithecini .
